TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DetailsViewDesigner extends System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DataBoundControlDesigner

Docs.summary: Provides design-time support in a visual designer for the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In a visual designer, when you switch from Source to Design view, the markup source code that describes the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control is parsed and a design-time version of the control is created on the design surface. When you switch back to Source view, the design-time control is persisted to markup source code and edited into the markup for the Web page.
The properties of the DetailsViewDesigner class provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.ActionLists%2A> property returns a <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionListCollection> object, which typically contains an object that is derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.DesignerActionList> class for each level in the inheritance tree of the designer.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> property returns a collection of formatting schemes for display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.TemplateGroups%2A> property returns a collection of template groups for the fields of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control and the top level <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> templates.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property always returns `true`, indicating that the designer creates a temporary copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control to generate the design-time markup.
The DetailsViewDesigner class methods provide the following functionality:
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.DataBind%2A> method binds the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control to a design-time data source.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method returns the markup that is used to render the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> at design time.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.Initialize%2A> method prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.OnClick%2A> method is called when a region of the design-time view of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> is clicked.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.OnSchemaRefreshed%2A> method is called when the schema of the data source of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> changes.
- The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method is used to remove or add additional properties or to shadow properties of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>.
Design-time editable regions are not supported in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control, so the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.GetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.SetEditableDesignerRegionContent%2A> methods have no functionality.
## Examples The following code example shows how to extend the DetailsViewDesigner class to change the appearance of controls that are derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control at design time.
The example derives the `MyDetailsView` control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>. The `MyDetailsView` is simply a copy of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control. The example also derives the `MyDetailsViewDesigner` class from DetailsViewDesigner and places a <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerAttribute> object for `MyDetailsViewDesigner` on the `MyDetailsView` control.
`The MyDetailsViewDesigner` overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.SampleRowCount%2A> property to specify that the pager row of the design-time view of the `MyDetailsView` contain five page links. It overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method to make the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.NamingContainer%2A> property visible in the **Property** grid at design time. It overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to include the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Caption%2A> property, if it is specified, as a new first row in the `MyDetailsView` grid at design time. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property of the `MyDetailsView` is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> value, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> draws a blue dashed border around the control to make its extent more visible.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.design.w_12_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.design.w_12_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The .NET Framework internally constructs a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner> class when it creates the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control or a copy of that control on the design surface.

Docs.summary: Gets the designer action list collection for this designer.
Gets the collection of automatic formatting schemes to display in the **Auto Format** dialog box.
Docs.value: A that contains the predefined schemes for the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection> is populated from an XML-encoded member of an internal class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void DataBind(class System.Web.UI.WebControls.BaseDataBoundControl dataBoundControl) cil managed

Docs.param: The control to bind to the design-time data source.
Docs.summary: Binds the associated control to the design-time data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The DataBind method binds the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control to the design-time data source and calculates the number of pager and automatically generated rows that are required, based on features that are specified for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>.
The `dataBoundControl` parameter represents the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control that is associated with this designer, or a copy of that control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.String> containing the markup used to render the at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks First, the GetDesignTimeHtml method sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.AutoGenerateRows%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control to `true`, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Fields%2A> collection is empty. The GetDesignTimeHtml then sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.DataKeyNames%2A> collection of the GetDesignTimeHtml control to an empty <xref:System.String> array if the schema of the data source cannot be obtained. It refreshes the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> object to force the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method to be called. It then calls the base method to generate the markup.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the GetDesignTimeHtml method in a class inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner> class to change the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control at design time. The example adds a new first row to the grid to contain the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Caption%2A> property, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Caption%2A> is defined. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property of the control that is derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> value, the GetDesignTimeHtml draws a blue dashed border around the control to make its extent more visible. It does not change the run-time appearance of the control.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.design.w_2_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.design.w_2_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetDesignTimeHtml(class System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionCollection regions) cil managed

Docs.param: A to which to add definitions of the selectable and clickable regions in the design-time view of the control.
Docs.summary: Gets the markup that is used to render the associated control at design time and populates a collection of designer regions.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.String> containing the markup used to render the at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The GetDesignTimeHtml method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to generate the markup for the design-time rendering of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control. The GetDesignTimeHtml method also populates `regions` with a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegion> object for each clickable or selectable region of the design-time rendering.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>, the first cell in each row is selectable; all the cells in the rows are clickable.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner> class to change the appearance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control at design time. The example adds a new first row to the grid to contain the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Caption%2A> property, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Caption%2A> is defined. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> property of the control that is derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.BorderStyle> value, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> draws a blue dashed border around the control to make its extent more visible. It does not change the run-time appearance of the control.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner#4](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/b6b11513-0637-4403-b729-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner#4](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/b6b11513-0637-4403-b729-_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string GetEditableDesignerRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region) cil managed

Docs.param: The for which to fetch content.
Docs.summary: Returns the content for an editable region of the design-time view of the associated control.
Docs.returns: The content for an editable region of the design-time view of the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This functionality is not currently available.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(class System.ComponentModel.IComponent component) cil managed

Docs.summary: Prepares the designer to view, edit, and design the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The designer host calls the Initialize method when it is ready to use the designer to render the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control. The Initialize and its base methods configure properties and set up events that are necessary for the operation of the designer.
The `component` parameter represents the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control that is associated with this designer or a copy of that control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnClick(class System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerRegionMouseEventArgs e) cil managed

Docs.param: A that defines the clicked region of the control.
Docs.summary: Called when a region of the design-time view for the associated control is clicked.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The OnClick method saves the selected region index and updates the markup that renders the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control on the design surface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnSchemaRefreshed() cil managed

Docs.summary: Called when the schema of the data source for the associated control changes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Unless the designer is in template editing mode or a field is being added or edited, the OnSchemaRefreshed method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.InvokeTransactedChange%2A> method, which in turn calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner.OnComponentChanged%2A> method to update the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control to reflect the data source change.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void PreFilterProperties(class System.Collections.IDictionary properties) cil managed

Docs.param: A collection implementing the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> of the added and shadowed properties.
Docs.summary: Used by the designer to remove properties from or add properties to the display in the grid or to shadow properties of the associated control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Control designers use methods derived from the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Design.ComponentDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to shadow various control properties with corresponding design-time properties that the designer implements, and to add properties to or remove properties from the `Properties` grid.
For the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control, the PreFilterProperties method sets the <xref:System.ComponentModel.BrowsableAttribute> object of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.Fields%2A> property to `false` when the control is in template mode. This ensures that a column that is in template mode cannot be deleted using the `Fields` dialog box.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the PreFilterProperties method in a class that is inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner> class to change the `Properties` grid of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control at design time. The example makes the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.NamingContainer%2A> property visible in the `Properties` grid.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/59da7cc7-2ede-4528-b3e3-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/59da7cc7-2ede-4528-b3e3-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets the number of sample rows for the associated control to display.
Docs.value: The number of sample rows to show.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The SampleRowCount property always returns the number `2`. This causes two page links to be displayed in the pager row of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control at design time.
## Examples The following code example shows how to override the SampleRowCount property in a class inherited from the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner> class to change the number of page links appearing in the pager row of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control at design time. The example causes five page links to be displayed.
[!code-cs[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.design.w_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.DetailsViewDesigner#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.design.w_0_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: public override void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent (System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void SetEditableDesignerRegionContent(class System.Web.UI.Design.EditableDesignerRegion region, string content) cil managed

Docs.summary: Specifies content for an editable region of the design-time view of the associated control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The SetEditableDesignerRegionContent method has no functionality; there is no support for editable regions in the design-time view of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of template groups for the fields of the associated control.
Docs.value: A containing an element for each templated field in the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The TemplateGroups property constructs a collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> objects, one for each templated data field and one for each control field (such as header, footer, and pager) in the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control. The data field <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> elements have a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition> object for each of the predefined row template types. The control field <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateGroup> elements contain a single <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TemplateDefinition>.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy, rather than the actual control associated with the designer, to generate the design-time markup.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Because the UsePreviewControl property is always `true`, the designer uses a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control that contains a copy of the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control to generate the design-time markup. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.View> control does not affect any persistence for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>. If the UsePreviewControl property has been overridden to return `false`, the designer will use the associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control itself to generate the design-time markup.
